articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Birthday Present to Russian Musician
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Birthday Present to Russian Musician

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a present to Professor Stanislav Kalinin, dean of the Conducting Faculty of the Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory of Russia, on his 70th birthday.
					
					 The presentation ceremony took place at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Oct. 27.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Vladimir Sukhanov, director for the International Cooperation Department of the Conservatory, and Composer Nikolai Druzhenkov.
					
					 Om Ha Jin, rector of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory, Ambassador Kim Yong Jae and other staff members of the DPRK embassy attended.
					
					 The present was handed over to the professor.
					
					 He, reflecting warm feelings of himself and his family, extended sincere thanks to Kim Jong Il, a great man of the world and outstanding statesman, for sending the wonderful birthday present, busy as he was with the guidance of the overall work of the party, the state and the army.
					
					 He said he and his family wholeheartedly wish Kim Jong Il good health and greater successes in his work for the happiness of the Korean people and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Title of Honorary Professor Awarded to Russian Musician
articles.content:
Title of Honorary Professor Awarded to Russian Musician

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The title of honorary professor of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory was awarded to Pro. Stanislav Kalinin, dean of the Conducting Faculty of the Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory of Russia.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Russian Conservatory on October 26.
					
					 Present there were Om Ha Jin, rector of the DPRK Conservatory, and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Moscow and Alexandr Sokolov, president of the Russian Conservatory, Vladimir Sukhanov, director for the International Cooperation Department of the Conservatory.
					
					 The certificate of the title of honorary professor of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory was conferred on Stanislav Kalinin.
					
					 He extended sincere thanks to Kim Jong Il for bestowing such glory on him.
					
					 The professor expressed his will to repay the benevolence and trust of Kim Jong Il by contributing to the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and conservatories in the future.

articles.title: Census Atlas Published
articles.content:
Census Atlas Published

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- An atlas showing census results in the form of geographical distribution was published in the DPRK recently.
					
					 The book gives the census results, divided into administrative districts, population, families, education and dwelling houses.
					
					Each map has relevant explanations.
					
					 The atlas was made in cooperation with the United Nations Population Fund.

articles.title: Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons Built in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons Built in Pyongyang 

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Kumkop (gold cup) Combined Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons has made its appearance in Pyongyang.
					
					 The factory produces rice cake, bread, confectionary, processed meat and drinks. It also has welfare facilities for its employees.
					
					 The drinks, including carbonated water and nutritious water, are made with natural medicinal materials good for recovery from fatigue and promotion of health.
					
					 Ri Jong Ho, manager of the factory, told KCNA that the factory will put its production and management activities on a scientific and IT basis to massproduce quality foodstuffs needed for sportspersons.

articles.title: New Feature Film Produced
articles.content:
New Feature Film Produced 

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean Film Studio produced a new feature film "Flower Blooming in Snow".
					
					The film is based on a real life story that General Secretary Kim Jong Il praised a woman manager in Jagang Province, who contributed to bringing a factory back online and devoted her all to the work for the country's future, and put her forward as a model of the era.
					
					 In Sun, the main character of the film, was appointed as the manager of a factory that went dormant during the Arduous March. She arouses its employees to the drive to implement the behests of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Busy as she was as an official in charge of the factory, she looks after children of deceased machinists and let them take the place of their mothers.
					
					 The employees, touched by her sincerity, turn out to convert a small local industrial factory into the base of light industry conducive to the prosperity of country.

articles.title: DPRK Awarded Top Prize at World Horticultural Expo
articles.content:
DPRK Awarded Top Prize at World Horticultural Expo

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee for the 2011 World Horticultural Expo in Xian awarded the top design prize to the DPRK garden and the top organization and operation prize to the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee of the DPRK.
					
					 Diplomas and cups were handed over to the head of the delegation of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee on October 22.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Flies back Home
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Flies back Home

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Beijing Service Bureau for Diplomatic Missions of China headed by Deputy Director-General Lu Huizao left here for home by air on Friday.

articles.title: Hungnam Fertilizer Complex
articles.content:
Hungnam Fertilizer Complex

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, a giant base of chemical industry in the DPRK, began producing fertilizers with raw materials available in the country, while cutting down the consumption of electricity.
					
					 The complex completed a large-scale ammonia production process, the first-stage gasification project.
					
					 The project makes it possible to produce fertilizers with lignite rich in east coastal areas as raw materials, while sharply reducing the production cost and remarkably increasing the output.
					
					 The project was finished in the wake of a large-scale anthracite gasification project completed on a modern basis at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex on the west coast of the country. The completed projects are a triumph of President Kim Il Sung's idea of building a self-reliant chemical industry and a result of the country's self-supporting economy.
					
					 The Hungnam Fertilizer Complex plays an important role in the nation's grain output. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists built a fertilizer factory there in 1927 when they were occupying Korea, with the aim of solving the food shortage in Japan.
					
					 But they severely demolished the factory when they suffered a defeat in the Second World War. 
					
					Though it was rebuilt after the liberation of the country, it was reduced to ashes again in the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					
					 After the ceasefire, the factory was reconstructed on a modern and enlarged basis.
					
					 In his lifetime, the President provided field guidance to the complex many times to indicate ways for its development. His famous proposition "Fertilizer immediately means rice and rice, socialism" came during his field guidance to the complex. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il took a measure to update the complex's production processes so that they could be based on domestically available raw materials.
					
					 The complex is now working on the second-stage gasification project.

articles.title: Monument to Loyalty
articles.content:
Monument to Loyalty

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- There is the Monument to Loyalty in Sonjuk-dong, Kaesong City, DPRK.
					
					 Kings Yongjo and Kojong of Ri Dynasty (1392-1910) had the monument built in praise of loyalty of Jong Mong Ju (1337-1392), an official of Koryo kingdom.
					
					 The monument has two tombstones erected in 1740 and 1872 respectively.
					
					Each tombstone consists of a bottom stone, turtle-shaped stay and body and head parts. The body part is dark marble and the rest is grey granite. 
					
					 The turtle-shaped stay is a sculpture made with a monolith over ten tonnes weigh.
					
					 The epitaph contains a poem written by a king and explanations of why the tombstones were erected and how Jong was faithful to the country.

articles.title: Sa Myong Dang, Righteous Monk
articles.content:
Sa Myong Dang, Righteous Monk

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Sa Myong Dang was a righteous monk who distinguished himself in the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598).
					
					He had been interested in Confucianism and good at literature from his childhood.
					
					 When the Imjin Patriotic War broke out, he organized a volunteers' unit with monks in Mt. Kumgang and fought against the Japanese invaders under the command of great Buddhist priest Sosan in Sunan.
					
					 He entered the enemy's camp at Ulsan in Kyongsang Province three times in 1594 to turn down the invaders' arrogant demands with his well-reasoned eloquence.
					
					 He went to Japan in 1604 for peace talks and got assurance from Japan that it would never invade Korea again.
					
					 He returned home with thousands of people brought to Japan during the war.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on By-election to Local Self-governing Bodies in S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on By-election to Local Self-governing Bodies in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Grand National Party of south Korea suffered bitter defeat in the by-election to local self-governing bodies on Wednesday. 
					
					 A candidate from the camp for democratic reform won the Seoul mayoralty called "junior presidency" in the by-election to fill up 30 odd vacancies. 
					
					 He gained 53.4 percent of the vote to defeat his rival from the GNP who garnered 46.2 percent. 
					
					 The GNP clan employed every possible form of tactics to win in the Seoul mayoral race, seen as a key test of voter sentiment ahead of parliamentary and presidential elections next year, but in vain. 
					
					 It was defeated in the election to local autonomous bodies last year and the by-election in April this year.
					
					 The GNP's succession of defeats eloquently shows that the fate of political philistines of south Korea who betrayed the people can never change. 
					
					 The election results are the severe judgment delivered by the people on the south Korean ruling quarters which pursued traitorous and unpopular policy against reunification through flunkeyism, treachery, confrontation with fellow countrymen, unpopular rule, irregularities and corruption, thereby violating independence and democracy, driving the people to destitution and bedeviling the north-south relations. 
					
					 As history proved, the traitorous regime, which relies on outsiders while betraying its own nation and people, can not last long nor evade the fate of evening twilight. 
					
					 The south Korean conservative forces are despicable pro-U.S. sycophants and traitors who remain in power by selling the interests of the nation to outsiders. 
					
					 No sooner had the group come to power than it offered political, economic and military all other fields to the U.S. It even did not hesitate to perpetrate the crime of forging military tie-up with the sworn enemy Japan. 
					
					 The group is made up unpardonable anti-reunification elements as it marred the north-south relations, while blocking national reconciliation and unity. 
					
					 The north-south relations that had favorably developed after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration suddenly came to a stalemate since the GNP came to power. 
					
					 Out of its sinister intention to do harm to the north militarily, the group regularly staged joint military exercises with outsiders and orchestrated serious provocations, driving the situation to the brink of war. As a result, the north and the south of Korea faced extreme mistrust and military confrontation. 
					
					 The three years of the conservative group in power were rife with crimes it committed by enforcing the policy in favor of the rich and plutocrats and exploiting people to meet their own greedy interests. 
					
					 The GNP has pursued unpopular economic policy representing the interests of only a handful of the privileged despite its lip-service for "pro-common people policy". This has worsened the social evil of "the rich getting ever richer and the poor ever poorer" and deteriorated the people's livelihood. 
					
					 The unemployed flood the streets and toiling masses are suffering from sky-rocketing prices of goods, taxes and registration fees. A lot of hopeless people commit suicides and the south Korean society is going rotten with all sorts of crimes, illegality and corruption pervading it. This is the reality brought about by the GNP which committed to "policy bringing hope to people".
					
					 Now south Koreans deplore the difficult living conditions, saying "everyday is like living in the hell," "everything has become worse," "it has become more difficult to live," "the hands of clock of democratization has gone back to that in the 1980s". This reflects their mindset. 
					
					 South Korean media describe the defeat of the conservative group and victory of the democratic forces as super political storm. 
					
					 The table has tilted in disfavor of the traitorous regime.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun U.S. Is Chiefly Responsible for Tension in Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun U.S. Is Chiefly Responsible for Tension in Korean Peninsula

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Recently the United States introduced twelve F-16C fighters into its air base in Kunsan, south Korea. The fighters from the Hill Air Base in Utah State of the U.S. belong to the 419th and 388th combat air divisions of the U.S. imperialist forces. About 200 troops of the U.S air force were deployed along with those fighters.
					
					 The U.S. claimed that their deployment was to reaffirm its commitment to provision of proper deterrent for defense of south Korea.
					
					 Commenting on this fact, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun today says:
					
					 The U.S. seeks to justify its adventurous military action with the word of "defense", but such trick can never work on others.
					
					 The deployment of F-16C fighters is evidently targeted against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is also seeking another aim in their deployment. F-16C is not only for conducting military operation in such narrow region as the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It is the U.S. goal to realize its Asia-Pacific strategy of aggression by force. It is mulling backing this goal with the powerful armed forces. With south Korea as a springboard the U.S. intends to stifle the DPRK by strength and, furthermore, contain big countries around it and thus establish its hegemony in the region.
					
					 As part of such scheme, the U.S. trigger-happy forces have pressured south Korean puppet forces to build a naval base on Jeju Island.
					
					 This naval base will help various war means of the U.S., including nuclear-powered carrier flotilla and nuclear submarine, have free access to the island, and then the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity will be surely embroiled in consistent danger of war.
					
					 The U.S. will be cursed as the mastermind of stirring up arms race and escalating the international tension and the chief criminal destroying global peace and security.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun By-election in S. Korea Termed Victory of Progressive Forces
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun By-election in S. Korea Termed Victory of Progressive Forces

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday carries its commentator's article as regards the by-election to local autonomous bodies that took place in south Korea on Wednesday.
					
					 The election results were the people's stern punishment of the ruling quarters who crudely violated independence and democracy, deteriorated the people's livelihood and pushed the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophe. It was a right option of the south Koreans desirous of new policy, new society, improvement of the north-south relations and reunification of Korea, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The election was a serious showdown between democracy and fascism, between progressivism and conservatism, between civic and social forces and outdated political forces and between the new and the old.
					
					 The people of different strata including young people desirous of the new unanimously voted for the candidate from progressive forces, sympathizing with his slogan and political commitment for social change, thus leading him to a landslide victory.
					
					 The election was little different from a civil revolution that demonstrated the south Koreans' stamina.
					
					 The U.S. had been deeply involved in the election.
					
					 It intensified nexus with the puppet conservative ruling forces ahead of the election and openly supported the puppet conservative forces, saying the leftist camp's victory may jeopardize the "alliance".
					
					 The mayoral election could, therefore, be assessed as a shining victory of the patriotic forces for independent reunification over pro-U.S. sycophants and anti-reunification forces.
					
					 The election clearly showed once again the truth that no one should go against the desire of the public and the trend of the times and the people from all walks of life including the progressive forces for democratic reform can get what they want if they pool their efforts.
					
					 It also showed that deception, falsity, plot, intrigue and anti-DPRK confrontation policy do not work on south Koreans and people's judgment is correct and wise. It also demonstrated their wisdom and spirit.
					
					 The south Korean authorities and the "Grand National Party" had better draw a lesson from the results of the by-election including Seoul mayoral election and swim with the tide of the times.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dynamic General Offensive
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dynamic General Offensive

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- All the officials, party members and other working people of the country should give steady spurs to the drive for a great surge and dynamically advance toward the gate of prosperity by following the example set by people of South Hamgyong Province. Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an editorial. 
					
					 The flame kindled up in South Hamgyong Province represents the breath of heroic Korea dashing toward a thriving nation and the banner of victory of the Songun revolutionary surge, the editorial says, and continues:
					
					The flame is an indication of the transparent faith to carry out the intention of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance to make the country a world power. It is also a manifestation of the spirit of vanguard to take the lead in opening the gate to a thriving nation by working hard in one's own neighborhoods and worksites.
					
					 It also represents the ardent loyalty of the Juche-type revolutionaries who value the behests of President Kim Il Sung and successfully implement them. 
					
					 It is the spirit of strong national dignity of the people of South Hamgyong Province to decisively shatter the sanctions and blockade of the imperialist reactionaries with the hammer of self-supporting economy. It also represents popular heroism to bravely overcome any difficulties by dint of the strength and wisdom of the masses as well as indomitable spirit to stand up again and again till they win a final victory despite hundreds of failures. 
					
					 The revolutionary capabilities and scientific creativity are main factors that enabled people in South Hamgyong Province to create new Chollima speed, Korean-style speed, and emerge ever-victorious in the production and construction. 
					
					 Let us wage a general offensive for a great victory in 2012, following the flame of South Hamgyong Province! This is the militant banner we must uphold. All the units and local areas of the country should dynamically wage the general offensive to create the new speed of advance following the flame.

articles.title: WPK's Anniversary Celebrated in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Awarded Top Prize at World Horticultural Expo

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee for the 2011 World Horticultural Expo in Xian awarded the top design prize to the DPRK garden and the top organization and operation prize to the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee of the DPRK.
					
					 Diplomas and cups were handed over to the head of the delegation of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee on October 22.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS on Fruit Processing Factory in DPRK
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS on Fruit Processing Factory in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The ITAR-TASS of Russia on Monday introduced the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory in the DPRK. 
					
					 The factory was built by soldiers in a short span of time and went into operation, the news agency noted, elaborating on the scale of the factory, varieties of products, etc. 
					
					 Experts constantly raise the quality of products, and the factory is equipped with automatically-controlled processes including fruit processing and cooling, it said.
					
					 It also introduced the prospect of the factory. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to this factory despite sweltering weather in July last, the agency said.

articles.title: U.S., Japan Urged to Drop Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
U.S., Japan Urged to Drop Hostile Policy toward DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the C.C., People's Socialist Party of Mexico, made public a statement on Oct. 22 as regards the fact that General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave answers to questions put by the ITAR-TASS of Russia. 
					
					 In his answers Kim Jong Il clarified the prospect of the development of the DPRK-Russia relations, nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula, resumption of the six-party talks, the DPRK's relations with the U.S. and Japan and other issues, the statement noted, saying:
					
					 We hold that the U.S. should drop its hostile policy toward the DPRK and show good faith to the DPRK as urged by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Japan, which historically committed untold crimes against the Korean people, too, should make a bold decision to settle its inglorious past, roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for mending the fence with it.

articles.title: Chinese People Urged to Implement Spirit of Party Plenum
articles.content:
Chinese People Urged to Implement Spirit of Party Plenum

					 Beijing, October 27 (KCNA) -- A senior Chinese official called for launching a campaign for studying and introducing the spirit of the 6th Plenary Session of the 17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC).
					
					  Speaking at a meeting held in Beijing on Tuesday, Li Changchun, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee, said it is important to let the people know well about the guiding idea, major policy and requirement for the development of the cultural reform, strategic target for the building of a socialist cultural power and tasks to be fulfilled by 2020.     
					
					 Therefore, all cadres and masses should be encouraged to turn out in the effort for opening up a new phase of cultural construction with much enthusiasm and greeting the 18th CPC Congress with great achievements, he added.

articles.title: Improvement of Mass Work Urged in China
articles.content:
Improvement of Mass Work Urged in China

					 Beijing, October 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting of exchanging experience in the mass work was held in Yunnan Province from Oct. 22 to 23 under the sponsorship of the Organization Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and the Central Office for Safeguarding Security. 
					
					 The meeting called for strengthening the building of basic party organizations and the ranks of their officials, improving the mass work under the new situation and encouraging officials to have direct contacts with the masses.

articles.title: Military Culture Should be Improved: Chinese Official
articles.content:
Military Culture Should be Improved: Chinese Official

					 Beijing, October 27 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for promoting the prosperity and development of advanced military culture.
					
					 Addressing a meeting of studying the spirit of the 6th Plenum of the 17th C.C., the Communist Party of China Wednesday, Xu said the advanced military culture should be developed in line with President Hu Jintao's important instructions.
					
					  By doing so, a definite ideological guarantee and powerful spiritual motive force should be provided to promote a scientific development of the army and discharge its historic mission in an effective way, the vice-chairman added.

articles.title: China Willing to Strengthen International Cooperation against Hacking
articles.content:
China Willing to Strengthen International Cooperation against Hackers

					 Beijing, October 27 (KCNA) -- China's Foreign Ministry spokesperson voiced the government's position of opposing any activities attacking Internet networks. 
					
					 Referring to a media report alleging that the House of Representatives, Foreign Ministry and some other organs of Japan were attacked by China-based hackers, Jiang Yu said the allegation was non-expert and irresponsible because there had been no investigation. 
					
					 China is willing to strengthen cooperation with international community against hackers and jointly combat their illegal activities, Jiang added.

articles.title: China Urges U.S. to End Blockade against Cuba
articles.content:
China Urges U.S. to End Blockade against Cuba

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Chinese delegate to the UN General Assembly addressing its session on October 25 urged the U.S. to immediately stop its sanctions and blockade against Cuba.
					
					 The blockade is an apparent violation of the UN charter, he noted, stressing that the U.S. should immediately end this blockade which impedes the development of the Latin American and the Caribbean region.
					
					 China would continue to develop the relations of friendship and economic cooperation with Cuba, he added.

articles.title: Electrification in Yunnan Province of China
articles.content:
Electrification in Yunnan Province of China

					 Beijing, October 27 (KCNA) -- Yunnan Province of China completed the electrification of 13 administrative villages in the past one year.
					
					 As a result, all the administrative villages of the province have been electrified.

articles.title: Russian FM Accuses U.S. of Its Unjust Measure
articles.content:
Russian FM Accuses U.S. of Its Unjust Measure

					 Moscow, October 27 (KCNA) -- Sergei Lavrov, foreign minister of Russia, accused the U.S. of its unjust measure on Wednesday.
					
					 He labeled it an unjust measure that the U.S. included Russia in the blacklist of countries of concern to the U.S., while pulling it up over a lawyer's death during prejudication.
					
					 The U.S. should raise issues and settle them through contacts with executive organs and the parliament, not just working out "blacklist", he stressed.

articles.title: Iran Warns West against Plots
articles.content:
Iran Warns West against Plots 

					 Teheran, October 27 (KCNA) -- Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, president of Iran, made a speech in a rally on October 25 in which he warned the West not to breed plots against the regional countries.
					
					 He said the West is planning to realize the domination on the regional countries through deception and lie under the pretext of aid.
					
					 The era of colonialism has already ended and the people of the regional countries are sharpening their vigilance against the machinations of the West, he noted, adding the West should stop all sorts of inhuman acts and remove its military bases from the region.

articles.title: West's Hostility toward Iran Accused: Iranian FM
articles.content:
West's Hostility toward Iran Accused: Iranian FM

					 Tehran, October 27 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi, addressing a meeting on Monday, denounced the United States and other Western countries for their hostility toward Iran.
					
					 He accused them of creating a XenoIranian and releasing false picture of Iran. 
					
					 Europe is losing good opportunities for cooperation with Iran because it is following the U.S. policy, Ali Akbar Salehi said. 
					
					 He urged Europe to respect the sovereignty of other countries and stop such acts as making interfering remarks and adopting resolutions on slapping sanctions against Iran.

articles.title: UAE's Non-Oil Trade Grows 22 Percent in First Half of 2011
articles.content:
UAE's Non-Oil Trade Grows 22 Percent in First Half of 2011

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The United Arab Emirates' non-oil foreign trade hit 445 billion dirhams (about 122 billion U.S. dollars) in the first half of this year, an increase of 22 percent year on year, the Federal Customs Authority said in a statement published Monday.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev and his Armenian counterpart Serzh Sargsyan on Monday vowed to further develop bilateral cooperation in various fields.
					
					 Cuba and Ukraine inked a memorandum of understanding and some protocols to boost cooperation in transport, education, science, culture and sports in the coming years on Sunday.

articles.title: Demo against Disparity Staged in U.S.
articles.content:
Demo against Disparity Staged in U.S.

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A demo was staged against exploitation and oppression by the capital in Chicago of the Illinois State, the U.S., on Oct. 22.
					
					 Around 3,000 people from different social standings took part in the demo.
					
					 They strongly denounced the deepening gap between rich and poor in the country due to the authorities' unfair policy.

articles.title: U.S. Consumer Confidence Drops
articles.content:
U.S. Consumer Confidence Drops 

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A latest report on Tuesday showed that U.S. consumers felt more pessimistic about the economic outlook amid loft unemployment rate.
					
					 According to the New York-based Conference Board, its Consumer Confidence Index dropped to 39.8 in October, the lowest since March 2009.
					
					 One gauge of the index, which measures how Americans feel about the economy at the time of the survey, declined to 26.3 in October, from 33.3 in September.

articles.title: Australia's NSW Gov't Sticks to Target of Culling 5,000 Public Service Jobs
articles.content:
Australia's NSW Gov't Sticks to Target of Culling 5,000 Public Service Jobs

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Australia's New South Wales (NSW) Government has committed to its target of 5,000 public sector redundancies, the State Premier Barry O'Farrell said on Tuesday ahead of his announcement of the first round of the cuts.

articles.title: Drug Smuggling in Turkey
articles.content:
Drug Smuggling in Turkey

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Turkish police on Monday seized 163 kilograms of heroin in the southeastern province of Gaziantep, according to a report of the semi-official Anatolia news agency. The haul was seized in two separate operations in downtown Gaziantep, said the report, adding that two people were detained.
					
					 Meanwhile, Turkish security forces seized 283 kilograms of hashish in the southern province of Adana and southeastern province of Diyarbakir on the same day. 
					
					 The police also arrested 18 in connection with the illicit drugs, said the report.

articles.title: UNGA Resolution Urges U.S. Withdrawal of Blockade on Cuba
articles.content:
UNGA Resolution Urges U.S. Withdrawal of Blockade on Cuba

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The UN General Assembly Tuesday adopted a resolution demanding the United States roll back its economic blockade on Cuba.
					
					 The resolution garnered overwhelming support from member states.
					
					 It was the 20th time that the similar resolution was adopted at the UNGA.

articles.title: Torrential Rain Causes Flooding across UK
articles.content:
Torrential Rain Causes Flooding across UK

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Torrential rain has flooded parts of south-west England, Northern Ireland and Wales.
					
					 Some people went missing and public buildings were submerged, playing havoc with the daily life of the residents.
					
					 Roads have been inundated with water, paralyzing the traffic.

articles.title: Palestinian Official: No New U.S. Proposals for Resuming Peace Talks
articles.content:
Palestinian Official: No New U.S. Proposals for Resuming Peace Talks

					 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A senior Palestinian negotiator on Tuesday denied reports that the United States presented new proposals for resuming peace talks between the Palestinians and Israel.
					
					 Saeb Erekat, the negotiator, said the Palestinian leadership received no offers from the Obama administration regarding Jewish settlement activities.
					
					 Erekat reiterated that the Palestinian leadership wants Israel to recognize the two-state solution defined by the 1967 borderline and completely freeze the settlement activities.

articles.title: ACNC comenta resultado de elecciones en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACNC comenta resultado de elecciones en Sur de Corea

					　Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- El pasado dia 26, tuvieron lugar en el Sur de Corea las elecciones suplementarias de las entidades autonomas locales en que sufrio una gran derrota el "Gran Partido Nacional".
					
					　En esta ocasion, se compitio por mas de 30 candidaturas.
					
					　El candidato de las fuerzas partidarias de reformas democraticas fue elegido como alcalde de Seul, conocido como "presidente pequeno", ganando con 53.4% de votos frente a la aspirante del "GPN" con 46.2%.
					
					　Asi los compinches del "GPN", que recurrieron a todas las artimanas para que gane su candidata, perdieron en esas elecciones que influenciaran mucho en las elecciones de parlamentarios y las presidenciales del ano proximo.  
					
					　Las sucesivas derrotas de esa organizacion en las elecciones de autonomia local del ano pasado, las otras suplementarias en abril del ano en curso y en la presente ocasion demuestran elocuentemente que el fracaso es el destino manifiesto de los politiqueros surcoreanos que dan espaldas al pueblo.
					
					　El resultado del conteo de votos constituye la severa sentencia de la opinion publica sobre la politica antinacional, antipopular y anti-reunificacion de las fuerzas gobernantes surcoreanas, quienes con sus actos traidores y serviles a grandes potencias, campana de confrontacion fratricida, gobernacion antipopular y corrupcion, sofocaron la independencia y la democracia, depauperaron la vida de los habitantes y llevaron a la fase catastrofica las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					　Como demuestra la historia, el poder traidor, que depende de las potencias extranjeras dando espaldas a la nacion y al pueblo, no dura mucho ni puede evitar la decadencia.
					
					　Las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas son la banda servil a EE.UU. y traidora que mantiene su poder vendiendo los intereses nacionales a las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					　Desde la toma del poder, ellas sujetaron todos los asuntos politicos, economicos y militares a la determinacion de EE.UU. y cometieron sin vacilacion alguna el crimen de establecer la alianza militar con Japon, enemigo jurado de la nacion coreana.
					
					　Ademas, rompieron las relaciones intercoreanas estropeando la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion. Esos vinculos, que se desarrollaban favorablemente despues de publicada la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio, han sido congelados de repente cuando tomo el "poder" el "GPN".
					
					　Partiendo de la intencion de aplastar militarmente a la RPDC, libraron de modo sucesivo los entrenamientos militares conjuntos con las fuerzas extranjeras e inventaron graves incidentes de provocacion, llevando la situacion al umbral de guerra. Por eso, lo unico que queda entre ambas partes coreanas es la desconfianza extremada y agudo enfrentamiento militar.
					
					　3 anos de mandato de las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas son de crimenes cometidos practicando las politicas para los ricos y oligarcas y persiguiendo sus insaciables intereses a cambio del sudor y sangre del pueblo.
					
					　Debido a la politica economica del "GPN" de caracter antipopular, que representa los intereses de la minoria de privilegiados hablando hipocritamente de "estar a favor de humildes", se ha agravado el mal social de "los ricos se hacen cada vez mas ricos y los pobres cada vez mas pobres" y la vida del pueblo fue arruinada.
					
					　"Vivimos en el infierno", "Todo ha sido empeorado", "La vida se hizo mas dura", "La democracia dio marcha atras hacia la decada de 1980" y otros lamentos reflejan correctamente la opinion publica del Sur de Corea.
					
					　Los medios de prensa del Sur de Corea describen como tormenta politica supergrande la derrota sufrida en las recientes elecciones por la banda de conservadores y la victoria de las fuerzas democraticas.
					
					　Ya entro en decadencia el regimen traidor del Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Publicado en RPDC atlas sobre censo
articles.content:
Publicado en RPDC atlas sobre censo

					 Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo publicado en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea un atlas que demuestra de forma de distribucion geografica los datos del censo demografico recogidos recientemente en el pais.
					
					 Este libro los ofrece por tematico divididos por la division administrativa, la distribucion de la poblacion, la composicion de familias, la educacion y el uso de viviendas.
					
					 Cada mapa cuenta con su respectiva explicacion.
					
					 El atlas fue elaborado con la cooperacion del Fondo de la Poblacion de la ONU.

articles.title: RPDC recibe premios maximos en exposicion mundial
articles.content:
RPDC recibe premios maximos en exposicion mundial 

					 Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Comite Organizador de la Exposicion Mundial de Floricultura de Xi'an 2011 otorgo el premio maximo de diseno al jardin de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el premio maximo de organizacion y operacion al Comite Coreano de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia.
					
					 Los diplomas y copas fueron entregados el dia 22 al jefe de la delegacion del citado Comite Coreano.

articles.title: Inaugurado Combinado de Alimentos Kumkop para Deportistas
articles.content:
Inaugurado Combinado de Alimentos Kumkop para Deportistas

					　Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado el Combinado de Alimentos Kumkop para los Deportistas con el objetivo de suministrar los alimentos nutritivos a los deportistas. 
					
					  El combinado cuenta con los modernos procesos de produccion de tok, pan, confites, carne procesada y bebidas, depositos de materias primas y establecimientos culturales y de servicio publico para los empleados. 
					
					  Son ultramodernas todas las instalaciones de procesamiento de alimentos. 
					
					  Las bebidas como las carbonatadas y las nutritivas se elaboran con los materiales medicinales naturales que surten efecto para quitar la fatiga y fomentar la salud de los deportistas. 
					
					  El gerente Ri Jong Ho (de 38 anos de edad), citado por la ACNC, dijo que el combinado producira mucho mas alimentos sabrosos y nutritivos mediante la elevacion del nivel cientifico y cibernetico de la produccion y la gestion para que los deportistas coreanos puedan obtener buenas notas en las competencias nacionales e internacionales y glorificar el honor de la Corea del Juche.

articles.title: Filmada nueva pelicula "Flor en nieve"
articles.content:
Filmada nueva pelicula "Flor en nieve"

					 Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- Los Estudios Cinematograficos de Corea acabaron de filmar la pelicula de ficcion "Flor en nieve".
					
					 La cinta se basa en el hecho de que tras evaluar a la directora de una fabrica de la provincia de Jagang quien dedico todo lo suyo a la construccion de magnifica fabrica y a la labor para el futuro de la patria, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il la presento como flor de la epoca.
					
					 La protagonista In Sun, nombrada como directora de la fabrica en que quedaba suspendida la produccion en la Marcha Penosa, llama a las empleadas a la lucha por materializar el legado del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Aun estando tan ocupada por dirigir la fabrica, ella se encarga de los vastagos de las operadoras muertas en el proceso de cumplimiento de sus deberes y los cria para que mantuvieran fidedignamente los puestos de sus madres.
					
					 Las empleadas, emocionadas por sinceridad de ella, convierten la pequena fabrica de industria local en una base de industria ligera que da una gran ayuda al pais.
